member.name: T:UMapx.Analysis.Differential
member.summary:
Defines a class that implements a solution to a differential equation.
This class is a solution to the Cauchy problem for the ordinary differential equation y' = F(x, y).

member.name: T:UMapx.Analysis.Roots
member.summary:
Defines a class for solving equations using the spectral decomposition of a matrix.
More information can be found on the website: https://www.mathworks.com/help/matlab/ref/roots.html

member.summary: Initializes a class of equations using the spectral decomposition of a matrix.

member.summary: Gets or sets an error [0, 1].

member.summary: Returns a column vector corresponding to the numerical solution of the polynomial: p(1)*x^n + ... + p(n)*x + p(n+1) = 0.

member.summary: Returns a column vector of polynomial coefficients: p(1)*x^n + ... + p(n)*x + p(n+1) = 0.

member.name: M:UMapx.Core.Maths.Sieve(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Implements a sieve for finding prime numbers.
Recursive implementation of a memory-optimized segmented sieve of Eratosthenes. The operational complexity of the O(N* logN) algorithm.The memory complexity is O(Î”), where Î” = sqrt(N).

The hypergeometric function can be used in several variations: F(a,b,z); F(a,~,z); F(~,b,z); F(~,~,z). Instead of the â€œ~â€ sign, use the double.NaN value. More information can be found on the website: https://www.mathworks.com/help/symbolic/hypergeom.html#bt1nkmw-2

member.name: T:UMapx.Decomposition.Arnoldi
member.summary:
Defines Arnoldi transform.
This transformation is used to reduce the square matrix to the Hessenberg form. The matrix A is represented as the product of three matrices: A = Q * H * Q', where H is the upper Hessenberg triangular matrix, Q is the orthogonal matrix. More information can be found on the website: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Arnoldi_iteration

member.name: M:UMapx.Decomposition.Arnoldi.#ctor(System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary: Initializes Arnoldi transformation.

member.name: P:UMapx.Decomposition.Arnoldi.Q
member.summary: Returns the orthogonal matrix.

member.name: P:UMapx.Decomposition.Arnoldi.H
member.summary: Returns the upper triangular Hessenberg matrix.

member.name: T:UMapx.Decomposition.Cholesky
member.summary:
Defines Cholesky decomposition.
This is a representation of a symmetric positive definite square matrix in the form of a product: A = L * L ', where L is a lower triangular matrix with strictly positive elements on the diagonal. More information can be found on the website: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Cholesky_decomposition

member.name: M:UMapx.Decomposition.Cholesky.#ctor(System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary: Initializes Cholesky decomposition.

member.name: P:UMapx.Decomposition.Cholesky.L
member.summary: Gets the lower triangular matrix L.

member.name: P:UMapx.Decomposition.Cholesky.U
member.summary: Gets the upper triangular matrix U.

member.name: T:UMapx.Decomposition.Diagonal
member.summary:
Defines diagonal decomposition.
This is a representation of the square matrix A as the product of two matrices: A = B * D, where B is the Square matrix and D is the diagonal matrix. This decomposition is used to highlight diagonal matrices in other decompositions (for example, LDU-, LDL-decompositions).

member.name: M:UMapx.Decomposition.Diagonal.#ctor(System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary: Initializes diagonal decomposition.

member.name: P:UMapx.Decomposition.Diagonal.B
member.summary: Gets the square matrix.

member.name: P:UMapx.Decomposition.Diagonal.D
member.summary: Gets the vector of diagonal elements.

member.name: T:UMapx.Decomposition.EVD
member.summary:
Defines eigenvalue decomposition.
The eigenvalue decomposition is the representation of the square matrix A in the form of the product of three matrices A = V * D * inv (V), where V is the matrix of spectral vectors and D is the diagonal (generally complex) matrix of eigenvalues. The matrix A can also be represented as the product of three matrices: A = V * R * inv (V), where R is a real almost diagonal eigenvalue matrix. Not all matrices can be represented in this form, but only those that have a complete set of eigenvectors. Eigenvalue decomposition can be used to find the eigenvalues â€‹â€‹and eigenvectors of the matrix, solve linear systems of equations, invert the matrix, find the determinant of the matrix, and calculate the analytic functions of the matrices. More information can be found on the website: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eigendecomposition_of_a_matrix

member.name: M:UMapx.Decomposition.EVD.#ctor(System.Double[0:,0:],System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes eigenvalue decomposition.

member.name: P:UMapx.Decomposition.EVD.V
member.summary: Gets eigenvectors.

member.name: P:UMapx.Decomposition.EVD.D
member.summary: Gets eigenvalues.

member.name: P:UMapx.Decomposition.EVD.R
member.summary: Gets the real diagonal eigenvalue matrix.

member.name: P:UMapx.Decomposition.EVD.H
member.summary: Gets the Hessenberg form.

member.name: T:UMapx.Decomposition.GEVD
member.summary:
Defines generalized eigenvalue decomposition.
It is the task of finding a vector of values of V such that the representation: A * V = B * V * D. More information can be found on the website: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Eigendecomposition_of_a_matrix#Generalized_eigenvalue_problem

member.name: M:UMapx.Decomposition.GEVD.qzhes(System.Int32,System.Double[][],System.Double[][],System.Boolean,System.Double[][])
member.summary: Adaptation of the original Fortran QZHES routine from EISPACK.
member.remarks:
This subroutine is the first step of the qz algorithm for solving generalized matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. anal. 10, 241-256(1973) by Moler and Stewart.
This subroutine accepts a pair of real general matrices and reduces one of them to upper Hessenberg form and the other to upper triangular form using orthogonal transformations. it is usually followed by qzit, qzval and, possibly, qzvec.
For the full documentation, please check the original function.

member.name: M:UMapx.Decomposition.GEVD.qzit(System.Int32,System.Double[][],System.Double[][],System.Double,System.Boolean,System.Double[][],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Adaptation of the original Fortran QZIT routine from EISPACK.
member.remarks:
This subroutine is the second step of the qz algorithm for solving generalized matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. anal. 10, 241-256(1973) by Moler and Stewart, as modified in technical note nasa tn d-7305(1973) by ward.
This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in upper Hessenberg form and the other in upper triangular form. it reduces the Hessenberg matrix to quasi-triangular form using orthogonal transformations while maintaining the triangular form of the other matrix. it is usually preceded by qzhes and followed by qzval and, possibly, qzvec.
For the full documentation, please check the original function.

member.name: M:UMapx.Decomposition.GEVD.qzval(System.Int32,System.Double[][],System.Double[][],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Boolean,System.Double[][])
member.summary: Adaptation of the original Fortran QZVAL routine from EISPACK.
member.remarks:
This subroutine is the third step of the qz algorithm for solving generalized matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. anal. 10, 241-256(1973) by Moler and Stewart.
This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in quasi-triangular form and the other in upper triangular form. it reduces the quasi-triangular matrix further, so that any remaining 2-by-2 blocks correspond to pairs of complex Eigenvalues, and returns quantities whose ratios give the generalized eigenvalues. it is usually preceded by qzhes and qzit and may be followed by qzvec.
For the full documentation, please check the original function.

member.name: M:UMapx.Decomposition.GEVD.qzvec(System.Int32,System.Double[][],System.Double[][],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Double[][])
member.summary: Adaptation of the original Fortran QZVEC routine from EISPACK.
member.remarks:
This subroutine is the optional fourth step of the qz algorithm for solving generalized matrix eigenvalue problems, Siam J. Numer. anal. 10, 241-256(1973) by Moler and Stewart.
This subroutine accepts a pair of real matrices, one of them in quasi-triangular form (in which each 2-by-2 block corresponds to a pair of complex eigenvalues) and the other in upper triangular form. It computes the eigenvectors of the triangular problem and transforms the results back to the original coordinate system. it is usually preceded by qzhes, qzit, and qzval.
For the full documentation, please check the original function.

member.name: M:UMapx.Decomposition.GEVD.Epsilon(System.Double)
member.summary: Estimates unit round-off in quantities of size x.
member.remarks: This is a port of the epslon function from EISPACK.

member.summary: Returns with the sign of .
member.remarks: This is a port of the sign transfer function from EISPACK, and is is equivalent to C++'s std::copysign function.
member.returns: If B > 0 then the result is ABS(A), else it is -ABS(A).

member.name: T:UMapx.Decomposition.GramSchmidt
member.summary:
Defines the Gram-Schmidt orthogonalization process.
In mathematics, in particular linear algebra and numerical analysis, the Gram-Schmidt process is a method of orthonormalizing a set of vectors in the space of internal works. This procedure is actively used for orthogonalization of bases. More information can be found on the website: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gram%E2%80%93Schmidt_process

member.name: M:UMapx.Decomposition.GramSchmidt.#ctor(System.Double[0:,0:])

member.summary: Gets the orthogonal matrix Q.

member.summary: Returns the projection of horizontal vectors. proj[e, a]' = (e * a') / (e * e') .* e

member.summary: Returns the projection of horizontal vectors. proj[e, a]' = (e * a') / (e * e') .* e

member.name: T:UMapx.Decomposition.Hessenberg

Defines decomposition with a cast to Hessenberg form.
This is a representation of a square matrix in the form of a product of three matrices: A = P * H * P', where H is the Hessenberg form and P is the unitary matrix. More information can be found on the website: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hessenberg_matrix

member.name: T:UMapx.Decomposition.Householder
member.summary:
Defines Householder transformation.
This is a linear transformation H (u) of the vector space V, which describes its mapping with respect to the hyperplane, which passes through the origin. It was proposed in 1958 by the American mathematician Elston Scott Householder. Widely used in linear algebra for QR decomposition of a matrix. In addition, the Householder transform is actively used for orthogonalization of bases; ultimately, the Householder matrix has the following properties: H = H', H' * H = I; det(H) = -1. In this class, two types of the Householder transform are implemented: reduction to a three-diagonal matrix and construction of the Householder matrix from a given vector. In the first case, the original Square matrix is defined as: A = H * T * H '. More information can be found on the website: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Householder_transformation

member.summary: Initializes Householder transformation.

member.summary: Gets the diagonal matrix.

member.name: T:UMapx.Decomposition.QR
member.summary:
Defines QR decomposition.
This is a matrix representation in the form of a product of two matrices: A = Q * R, where Q is a unitary (or orthogonal) matrix, and R is an upper triangular matrix. QR decomposition is the basis of one of the search methods for eigenvectors and matrix numbers - the QR algorithm. More information can be found on the website: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/QR_decomposition

member.summary:
Defines RQ decomposition.
This is a matrix representation in the form of a product of two matrices: A = R * Q, where Q is a unitary (or orthogonal) matrix, and R is an upper triangular matrix. RQ decomposition is one of the modifications of the QR algorithm. More information can be found on the website: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/QR_decomposition

member.name: T:UMapx.Imaging.HomomorphicEnhancement
member.summary:
Defines the filter for homomorphic processing.
A homomorphic filter is most often used to equalize the illumination of images. It simultaneously normalizes the brightness of the image and increases the contrast.
More information can be found on the website: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Homomorphic_filtering

member.name: T:UMapx.Imaging.HoughLine
member.summary: Defines the Hough line.

member.name: F:UMapx.Imaging.HoughLine.Theta
member.summary:
Slope of the line [0, 180).
It is the angle between the polar axis and the radius of the line.

member.name: F:UMapx.Imaging.HoughLine.Radius
member.summary:
Line distance from the center of the image (-inf, +inf).
A negative radius line means that the line is at the bottom of the polar coordinate system. Therefore the angle Î¸ should be increased by 180 degrees, and Radius should be positive.

member.name: T:UMapx.Imaging.Operation
member.summary:
Defines the linear operation filter.
This filter works UMapxing to the following algorithm: C (x, y) = a * A (x, y) + b * B (x, y), where A, B are the original images, a, b are the coefficients.

member.name: T:UMapx.Imaging.ShadowsHighlightsCorrection
member.summary:
Defines the shadows and lights correction filter.
Shadow-Highlights correction is used to correct unevenly lit images. Unlike other local algorithms (for example, Single Scale Retinex, Homomorphic Enhancement, Flat-Field Correction) filter allows you to adjust the brightness values separately in dark and bright areas Images.

member.name: T:UMapx.Response.FIR
member.summary:
Defines a filter with a finite impulse response.
A filter with a finite impulse response (transverse filter, FIR filter or FIR filter) is one of the types of linear digital filters, a characteristic feature of which is the limited time of its impulse response (from some point in time it becomes exactly equal to zero). Such a filter is also called non-recursive due to the lack of feedback. The denominator of the transfer function of such a filter is a certain constant.

member.name: M:UMapx.Response.FIR.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a filter with a finite impulse response.

member.name: M:UMapx.Response.FIR.#ctor(System.Double[])
member.summary: Initializes a filter with a finite impulse response.

member.summary: Gets or sets the array of signal coefficients.

member.summary: Returns an array of filter response values when a discrete function is supplied.
member.returns: Discrete function in a Cartesian coordinate system

member.summary: Returns the frequency response of the filter.
member.returns: Discrete function in a Cartesian coordinate system

member.summary: Returns the phase-frequency response of a filter.
member.returns: Discrete function in a Cartesian coordinate system

member.name: T:UMapx.Response.IIR
member.summary:
Defines a filter with an infinite impulse response.
Filter with infinite impulse response (recursive filter, IIR filter or IIR filter) - a linear electronic filter, using one or more of its outputs as an input, i.e. forms a feedback. The main property of such filters is that their impulse response is of infinite length in the time domain, and the transfer function has a fractional rational look.

member.name: T:UMapx.Video.AsyncVideoSource
member.summary: Proxy video source for asynchronous processing of another nested video source.

remarks.para: The class represents a simple proxy, which wraps the specified with the aim of asynchronous processing of received video frames. The class intercepts event from the nested video source and fires it to clients from its own thread, which is different from the thread used by nested video source for video acquisition. This allows clients to perform processing of video frames without blocking video acquisition thread, which continue to run and acquire next video frame while current is still processed.

For example, letâ€™s suppose that it takes 100 ms for the nested video source to acquire single frame, so the original frame rate is 10 frames per second. Also letâ€™s assume that we have an image processing routine, which also takes 100 ms to process a single frame. If the acquisition and processing are done sequentially, then resulting frame rate will drop to 5 frames per second. However, if doing both in parallel, then there is a good chance to keep resulting frame rate equal (or close) to the original frame rate.

The class provides a bonus side effect - easer debugging of image processing routines, which are put into event handler. In many cases video source classes fire their event from a try/catch block, which makes it very hard to spot error made in user's code - the catch block simply hides exception raised in userâ€™s code. The does not have any try/catch blocks around firing of event, so always user gets exception in the case it comes from his code. At the same time nested video source is not affected by the user's exception, since it runs in different thread.
Sample usage:

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.AsyncVideoSource.NewFrame
member.summary: New frame event.

remarks.para: Notifies clients about new available frame from video source.

para.note: This event is fired from a different thread other than the video acquisition thread created by . This allows nested video frame to continue acquisition of the next video frame while clients perform processing of the current video frame.

Since video source may have multiple clients, each client is responsible for making a copy (cloning) of the passed video frame, because the video source disposes its own original copy after notifying of clients.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.AsyncVideoSource.VideoSourceError
member.summary: Video source error event.

remarks.para: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in video source object, for example internal exceptions.

para.note: Unlike event, this event is simply redirected to the corresponding event of the , so it is fired from the thread of the nested video source.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.AsyncVideoSource.PlayingFinished
member.summary: Video playing finished event.

remarks.para: This event is used to notify clients that the video playing has finished.

para.note: Unlike event, this event is simply redirected to the corresponding event of the , so it is fired from the thread of the nested video source.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.AsyncVideoSource.NestedVideoSource
member.summary: Nested video source which is the target for asynchronous processing.

remarks.para: The property is set through the class constructor.

All calls to this object are actually redirected to the nested video source. The only exception is the event, which is handled differently. This object gets event from the nested class and then fires another event, but from a different thread.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.AsyncVideoSource.SkipFramesIfBusy
member.summary: Specifies if the object should skip frames from the nested video source when it is busy.

remarks.para: Specifies if the object should skip frames from the nested video source in the case if it is still busy processing the previous video frame in its own thread.
Default value is set to .

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.AsyncVideoSource.Source
member.summary: Video source string.

remarks.para: The property is redirected to the corresponding property of , so check its documentation to find what it means.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.AsyncVideoSource.FramesReceived
member.summary: Received frames count.

remarks.para: Number of frames the nested video source received from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.AsyncVideoSource.BytesReceived
member.summary: Received bytes count.

remarks.para: Number of bytes the nested video source received from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.AsyncVideoSource.FramesProcessed
member.summary: Processed frames count.

remarks.para: The property keeps the number of processed video frames since the last access to this property.

The value of this property equals to in most cases if the property is set to - every received frame gets processed sooner or later. However, if the property is set to , then value of this property may be lower than the value of the property, which means that nested video source performs acquisition faster than client perform processing of the received frame and some frame are skipped from processing.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.AsyncVideoSource.IsRunning
member.summary: State of the video source.

remarks.para: Current state of the video source object - running or not.

remarks.para: Starts the nested video source and returns execution to caller. This object creates an extra thread which is used to fire events, so the image processing could be done on another thread without blocking video acquisition thread.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.FileVideoSource.PreventFreezing
member.summary: Prevent video freezing after screen saver and workstation lock or not.

remarks.para: The value specifies if the class should prevent video freezing during and after screen saver or workstation lock. To prevent freezing the DirectShow graph should not contain Renderer filter, which is added by Render() method of graph. However, in some cases it may be required to call Render() method of graph, since it may add some more filters, which may be required for playing video. So, the property is a trade off - it is possible to prevent video freezing skipping adding renderer filter or it is possible to keep renderer filter, but video may freeze during screen saver.

para.note: The property may become obsolete in the future when approach to disable freezing and adding all required filters is found.
The property should be set before calling method of the class to have effect.

remarks.para: Default value of this property is set to false.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.FileVideoSource.ReferenceClockEnabled
member.summary: Enables/disables reference clock on the graph.

remarks.para: Disabling reference clocks causes DirectShow graph to run as fast as it can process data. When enabled, it will process frames UMapxing to presentation time of a video file.

para.note: The property should be set before calling method of the class to have effect.

remarks.para: Default value of this property is set to true.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.Internals.IMediaFilter.Pause
member.summary: This method informs the filter to transition to the new state.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.Internals.IMediaFilter.Run(System.Int64)
member.summary: This method informs the filter to transition to the new (running) state. Passes a time value to synchronize independent streams.
member.param: Time value of the reference clock. The amount to be added to the IMediaSample time stamp to determine the time at which that sample should be rendered UMapxing to the reference clock. That is, it is the reference time at which a sample with a stream time of zero should be rendered.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.Internals.IMediaFilter.GetState(System.Int32,UMapx.Video.DirectShow.Internals.FilterState@)
member.summary: This method determines the filter's state.
member.param: Duration of the time-out, in milliseconds. To block indefinitely, pass INFINITE.
Returned state of the filter. States include stopped, paused, running, or intermediate (in the process of changing).

member.summary: This method retrieves the current reference clock in use by this filter.
member.param: Pointer to a reference clock; it will be set to the IReferenceClock interface.

member.name: T:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.Internals.IReferenceClock
member.summary:
The IReferenceClock interface provides the reference time for the filter graph.
Filters that can act as a reference clock can expose this interface. It is also exposed by the System Reference Clock. The filter graph manager uses this interface to synchronize the filter graph. Applications can use this interface to retrieve the current reference time, or to request notification of an elapsed time.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.Internals.IReferenceClock.GetTime(System.Int64@)
member.summary: The GetTime method retrieves the current reference time.
member.param: Pointer to a variable that receives the current time, in 100-nanosecond units.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.Internals.IReferenceClock.AdviseTime(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The AdviseTime method creates a one-shot advise request.
member.param: Base reference time, in 100-nanosecond units. See Remarks.
Stream offset time, in 100-nanosecond units. See Remarks.
Handle to an event, created by the caller.
Pointer to a variable that receives an identifier for the advise request.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.Internals.IReferenceClock.AdvisePeriodic(System.Int64,System.Int64,System.IntPtr,System.Int32@)
member.summary: The AdvisePeriodic method creates a periodic advise request.
member.param: Time of the first notification, in 100-nanosecond units. Must be greater than zero and less than MAX_TIME.
Time between notifications, in 100-nanosecond units. Must be greater than zero.
Handle to a semaphore, created by the caller.
Pointer to a variable that receives an identifier for the advise request.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.Internals.IReferenceClock.Unadvise(System.Int32)
member.summary: The Unadvise method removes a pending advise request.
member.param: Identifier of the request to remove. Use the value returned by IReferenceClock::AdviseTime or IReferenceClock::AdvisePeriodic in the pdwAdviseToken parameter.

member.name: T:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice
member.summary: Video source for local video capture device (for example USB webcam).

remarks.para: This video source class captures video data from local video capture device, like USB web camera (or internal), frame grabber, capture board - anything which supports DirectShow interface. For devices which has a shutter button or support external software triggering, the class also allows to do snapshots. Both video size and snapshot size can be configured.

example.para: The video_NewFrame event could have been defined as in any of the following examples:

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.CrossbarVideoInput
member.summary: Current video input of capture card.

remarks.para: The property specifies video input to use for video devices like capture cards (those which provide crossbar configuration). List of available video inputs can be obtained from property.
To check if the video device supports crossbar configuration, the method can be used.

para.note: This property can be set as before running video device, as while running it.

remarks.para: By default this property is set to , which means video input will not be set when running video device, but currently configured will be used. After video device is started this property will be updated anyway to tell current video input.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.AvailableCrossbarVideoInputs
member.summary: Available inputs of the video capture card.

remarks.para: The property provides list of video inputs for devices like video capture cards. Such devices usually provide several video inputs, which can be selected using crossbar. If video device represented by the object of this class supports crossbar, then this property will list all video inputs. However if it is a regular USB camera, for example, which does not provide crossbar configuration, the property will provide zero length array.
Video input to be used can be selected using . See also method, which provides crossbar configuration dialog.

para.note: It is recomended not to call this property immediately after method, since device may not start yet and provide its information. It is better to call the property before starting device or a bit after (but not immediately after).

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.ProvideSnapshots
member.summary: Specifies if snapshots should be provided or not.

remarks.para: Some USB cameras/devices may have a shutter button, which may result into snapshot if it is pressed. So the property specifies if the video source will try providing snapshots or not - it will check if the camera supports providing still image snapshots. If camera supports snapshots and the property is set to , then snapshots will be provided through event.
Check supported sizes of snapshots using property and set the desired size using property.

para.note: The property must be set before running the video source to take effect.

remarks.para: Default value of the property is set to .

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.NewFrame
member.summary: New frame event.

remarks.para: Notifies clients about new available frame from video source.

para.note: Since video source may have multiple clients, each client is responsible for making a copy (cloning) of the passed video frame, because the video source disposes its own original copy after notifying of clients.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.SnapshotFrame
member.summary: Snapshot frame event.

remarks.para: Notifies clients about new available snapshot frame - the one which comes when camera's snapshot/shutter button is pressed.
See documentation to for additional information.

para.note: Since video source may have multiple clients, each client is responsible for making a copy (cloning) of the passed snapshot frame, because the video source disposes its own original copy after notifying of clients.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.VideoSourceError
member.summary: Video source error event.
member.remarks: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in video source object, for example internal exceptions.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.PlayingFinished
member.summary: Video playing finished event.

remarks.para: This event is used to notify clients that the video playing has finished.

member.summary: Video source.
member.remarks: Video source is represented by moniker string of video capture device.

member.summary: Obsolete - no longer in use

remarks.para: The property is obsolete. Use property instead. Setting this property does not have any effect.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.DesiredSnapshotSize
member.summary: Obsolete - no longer in use

remarks.para: The property is obsolete. Use property instead. Setting this property does not have any effect.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.DesiredFrameRate
member.summary: Obsolete - no longer in use.

remarks.para: The property is obsolete. Setting this property does not have any effect.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.DesiredAverageTimePerFrame
member.summary: The desired average display time of the video frames, in 100-nanosecond units. There is no guarantee that the device will actually respect this setting, however some devices will not work unless this property is set. See remarks for details.

remarks.para:
This property controls the initialization of the AvgTimePerFrame member of the
DirectShow's VideoInfoHeader structure. In normal situations this property does not need to be set, but some combinations of hardware and DirectShow filters might require this property to be set to 0 to achieve a good frame rate. If this property is set to -1, the AvgTimePerFrame member will not be initialized at all.
The default value for this property is 0 (AvgTimePerFrame will be initialized with 0).

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.VideoResolution
member.summary: Video resolution to set.

remarks.para: The property allows to set one of the video resolutions supported by the camera. Use property to get the list of supported video resolutions.

para.note: The property must be set before camera is started to make any effect.

remarks.para: Default value of the property is set to , which means default video resolution is used.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.SnapshotResolution
member.summary: Snapshot resolution to set.

remarks.para: The property allows to set one of the snapshot resolutions supported by the camera. Use property to get the list of supported snapshot resolutions.

para.note: The property must be set before camera is started to make any effect.

remarks.para: Default value of the property is set to , which means default snapshot resolution is used.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.VideoCapabilities
member.summary: Video capabilities of the device.

remarks.para: The property provides list of device's video capabilities.

para.note: It is recomended not to call this property immediately after method, since device may not start yet and provide its information. It is better to call the property before starting device or a bit after (but not immediately after).

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.SnapshotCapabilities
member.summary: Snapshot capabilities of the device.

remarks.para: The property provides list of device's snapshot capabilities.
If the array has zero length, then it means that this device does not support making snapshots.
See documentation to for additional information.

para.note: It is recomended not to call this property immediately after method, since device may not start yet and provide its information. It is better to call the property before starting device or a bit after (but not immediately after).

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.SourceObject
member.summary: Source COM object of camera capture device.

remarks.para: The source COM object of camera capture device is exposed for the case when user may need get direct access to the object for making some custom configuration of camera through DirectShow interface, for example.
If camera is not running, the property is set to .

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.Start
member.summary: Start video source.
member.remarks: Starts video source and return execution to caller. Video source object creates background thread and notifies about new frames with the help of event.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.SignalToStop
member.summary: Signal video source to stop its work.
member.remarks: Signals video source to stop its background thread, stop to provide new frames and free resources.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.WaitForStop
member.summary: Wait for video source has stopped.
member.remarks: Waits for source stopping after it was signalled to stop using method.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.Stop
member.summary: Stop video source.

remarks.para: Stops video source aborting its thread.

para.note: Since the method aborts background thread, its usage is highly not preferred and should be done only if there are no other options. The correct way of stopping camera is signaling it stop and then waiting for background thread's completion.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.Free
member.summary: Free resource.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.DisplayPropertyPage(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Display property window for the video capture device providing its configuration capabilities.

para.note: If you pass parent window's handle to this method, then the displayed property page will become modal window and none of the controls from the parent window will be accessible. In order to make it modeless it is required to pass as parent window's handle.

member.exception: The video source does not support configuration property page.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.DisplayCrossbarPropertyPage(System.IntPtr)
member.summary: Display property page of video crossbar (Analog Video Crossbar filter).

remarks.para: The Analog Video Crossbar filter is modeled after a general switching matrix, with n inputs and m outputs. For example, a video card might have two external connectors: a coaxial connector for TV, and an S-video input. These would be represented as input pins on the filter. The displayed property page allows to configure the crossbar by selecting input of a video card to use.

para.note: This method can be invoked only when video source is running ( is ). Otherwise it generates exception.

remarks.para: Use method to check if running video source provides crossbar configuration.

member.exception: The video source must be running in order to display crossbar property page.
Crossbar configuration is not supported by currently running video source.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.CheckIfCrossbarAvailable
member.summary: Check if running video source provides crossbar for configuration.
member.returns: Returns if crossbar configuration is available or otherwise.

remarks.para: The method reports if the video source provides crossbar configuration using .

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.DirectShow.VideoCaptureDevice.SimulateTrigger
member.summary: Simulates an external trigger.

remarks.para: The method simulates external trigger for video cameras, which support providing still image snapshots. The effect is equivalent as pressing camera's shutter button - a snapshot will be provided through event.

para.note: The property must be set to to enable receiving snapshots.

member.name: T:UMapx.Video.IVideoSource
member.summary: Video source interface.
member.remarks: The interface describes common methods for different type of video sources.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.IVideoSource.NewFrame
member.summary: New frame event.

remarks.para: This event is used to notify clients about new available video frame.

para.note: Since video source may have multiple clients, each client is responsible for making a copy (cloning) of the passed video frame, but video source is responsible for disposing its own original copy after notifying of clients.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.IVideoSource.VideoSourceError
member.summary: Video source error event.
member.remarks: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in video source object, for example internal exceptions.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.IVideoSource.PlayingFinished
member.summary: Video playing finished event.

remarks.para: This event is used to notify clients that the video playing has finished.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.IVideoSource.Source
member.summary: Video source.
member.remarks: The meaning of the property depends on particular video source. Depending on video source it may be a file name, URL or any other string describing the video source.

member.summary: Received bytes count.
member.remarks: Number of bytes the video source provided from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.summary: Start video source.

member.summary: Signal video source to stop its work.

member.summary: Wait for video source has stopped.

member.summary: Stop video source.
member.remarks: Stops video source aborting its thread.

member.name: T:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream
member.summary: JPEG video source.

remarks.para: The video source constantly downloads JPEG files from the specified URL.
Sample usage:

para.note: Some cameras produce HTTP header, which does not conform strictly to standard, what leads to .NET exception. To avoid this exception the useUnsafeHeaderParsing configuration option of httpWebRequest should be set, what may be done using application configuration file.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.NewFrame
member.summary: New frame event.

remarks.para: Notifies clients about new available frame from video source.

para.note: Since video source may have multiple clients, each client is responsible for making a copy (cloning) of the passed video frame, because the video source disposes its own original copy after notifying of clients.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.VideoSourceError
member.summary: Video source error event.
member.remarks: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in video source object, for example internal exceptions.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.PlayingFinished
member.summary: Video playing finished event.

remarks.para: This event is used to notify clients that the video playing has finished.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.SeparateConnectionGroup
member.summary: Use or not separate connection group.
member.remarks: The property indicates to open web request in separate connection group.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.PreventCaching
member.summary: Use or not caching.
member.remarks: If the property is set to true, then a fake random parameter will be added to URL to prevent caching. It's required for clients, who are behind proxy server.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.FrameInterval
member.summary: Frame interval.
member.remarks: The property sets the interval in milliseconds betwen frames. If the property is set to 100, then the desired frame rate will be 10 frames per second. Default value is 0 - get new frames as fast as possible.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.Source
member.summary: Video source.
member.remarks: URL, which provides JPEG files.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.Login
member.summary: Login value.
member.remarks: Login required to access video source.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.Password
member.summary: Password value.
member.remarks: Password required to access video source.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.Proxy
member.summary: Gets or sets proxy information for the request.

remarks.para: The local computer or application config file may specify that a default proxy to be used. If the Proxy property is specified, then the proxy settings from the Proxy property overridea the local computer or application config file and the instance will use the proxy settings specified. If no proxy is specified in a config file and the Proxy property is unspecified, the request uses the proxy settings inherited from Internet Explorer on the local computer. If there are no proxy settings in Internet Explorer, the request is sent directly to the server.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.FramesReceived
member.summary: Received frames count.
member.remarks: Number of frames the video source provided from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.BytesReceived
member.summary: Received bytes count.
member.remarks: Number of bytes the video source provided from the moment of the last access to the property.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.RequestTimeout
member.summary: Request timeout value.

remarks.para: The property sets timeout value in milliseconds for web requests.
Default value is set 10000 milliseconds.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.IsRunning
member.summary: State of the video source.
member.remarks: Current state of video source object - running or not.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.ForceBasicAuthentication
member.summary: Force using of basic authentication when connecting to the video source.

remarks.para: For some IP cameras (TrendNET IP cameras, for example) using standard .NET's authentication via credentials does not seem to be working (seems like camera does not request for authentication, but expects corresponding headers to be present on connection request). So this property allows to force basic authentication by adding required HTTP headers when request is sent.
Default value is set to .

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.JPEGStream.Stop
member.summary: Stop video source.

remarks.para: Stops video source aborting its thread.

para.note: Since the method aborts background thread, its usage is highly not preferred and should be done only if there are no other options. The correct way of stopping camera is signaling it stop and then waiting for background thread's completion.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.MJPEGStream.HttpUserAgent
member.summary: User agent to specify in HTTP request header.

remarks.para: Some IP cameras check what is the requesting user agent and depending on it they provide video in different formats or do not provide it at all. The property sets the value of user agent string, which is sent to camera in request header.
Default value is set to "Mozilla/5.0". If the value is set to , the user agent string is not sent in request header.

para.note: The property must be set before starting video source to have any effect.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.ScreenCaptureStream.FrameInterval
member.summary: Time interval between making screen shots, ms.

remarks.para: The property specifies time interval in milliseconds between consequent screen captures. Expected frame rate of the stream should be approximately 1000/FrameInteval.
If the property is set to 0, then the stream will capture screen as fast as the system allows.
Default value is set to 100.

member.summary: AVI file video source.

Sample usage:

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.NewFrame
member.summary: New frame event.

remarks.para: Notifies clients about new available frame from video source.

para.note: Since video source may have multiple clients, each client is responsible for making a copy (cloning) of the passed video frame, because the video source disposes its own original copy after notifying of clients.

member.name: E:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.VideoSourceError
member.summary: Video source error event.
member.remarks: This event is used to notify clients about any type of errors occurred in video source object, for example internal exceptions.

member.summary: Video playing finished event.

remarks.para: This event is used to notify clients that the video playing has finished.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.FrameInterval
member.summary: Frame interval.

remarks.para: The property sets the interval in milliseconds between frames. If the property is set to 100, then the desired frame rate will be 10 frames per second.

para.note: Setting this property to 0 leads to no delay between video frames - frames are read as fast as possible.

remarks.para: Default value is set to 0.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.FrameIntervalFromSource
member.summary: Get frame interval from source or use manually specified.

remarks.para: The property specifies which frame rate to use for video playing. If the property is set to , then video is played with original frame rate, which is set in source AVI file. If the property is set to , then custom frame rate is used, which is calculated based on the manually specified frame interval.
Default value is set to .

member.summary: Video source.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.Start
member.summary: Start video source.
member.remarks: Starts video source and return execution to caller. Video source object creates background thread and notifies about new frames with the help of event.
member.exception: Video source is not specified.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.SignalToStop
member.summary: Signal video source to stop its work.
member.remarks: Signals video source to stop its background thread, stop to provide new frames and free resources.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.WaitForStop
member.summary: Wait for video source has stopped.
member.remarks: Waits for source stopping after it was signalled to stop using method.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIFileVideoSource.Stop
member.summary: Stop video source.

remarks.para: Stops video source aborting its thread.

para.note: Since the method aborts background thread, its usage is highly not preferred and should be done only if there are no other options. The correct way of stopping camera is signaling it stop and then waiting for background thread's completion.

member.summary: Free resource.

member.summary: Get next frame of opened video stream.

member.name: T:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIWriter
member.summary: AVI files writing using Video for Windows interface.

remarks.para: The class allows to write AVI files using Video for Windows API.
Sample usage:

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Width
member.summary: Width of video frames.

remarks.para: The property specifies the width of video frames, which are acceptable by method for saving, which is set in method.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Height
member.summary: Height of video frames.

remarks.para: The property specifies the height of video frames, which are acceptable by method for saving, which is set in method.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Position
member.summary: Current position in video stream.

remarks.para: The property tell current position in video stream, which actually equals to the amount of frames added using method.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.FrameRate
member.summary: Desired playing frame rate.

remarks.para: The property sets the video frame rate, which should be use during playing of the video to be saved.

para.note: The property should be set befor opening new file to take effect.

remarks.para: Default frame rate is set to 25.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Codec
member.summary: Codec used for video compression.

remarks.para: The property sets the FOURCC code of video compression codec, which needs to be used for video encoding.

para.note: The property should be set befor opening new file to take effect.

remarks.para: Default video codec is set "DIB ", which means no compression.

member.name: P:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.Quality
member.summary: Compression video quality.

remarks.para: The property sets video quality used by codec in order to balance compression rate and image quality. The quality is measured usually in the [0, 100] range.

para.note: The property should be set befor opening new file to take effect.

remarks.para: Default value is set to -1 - default compression quality of the codec.

A error occurred while creating new video file. See exception message.

member.summary: Close video file.

member.name: M:UMapx.Video.VFW.AVIWriter.AddFrame(System.Drawing.Bitmap)

remarks.para: The method adds new video frame to an opened video file. The width and heights of the frame should be the same as it was specified in method (see and properties).

member.exception: Thrown if no video file was open.
Bitmap size must be of the same as video size, which was specified on opening video file.
A error occurred while writing new video frame. See exception message.

member.name: T:UMapx.Wavelet.WaveletTransform
member.summary:
Defines a discrete wavelet transform.
For the correct wavelet transform of a signal, it is necessary that its dimension be a power of 2.
More information can be found on the website: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Discrete_wavelet_transform

member.name: T:UMapx.Window.FastWeylHeisenbergTransform
member.summary:
Defines fast Weyl-Heisenberg transform.
The class represents a computationally efficient implementation of one-dimensional and two-dimensional discrete orthogonal Weyl-Heisenberg transforms. More information can be found on the website: https://ieeexplore.ieee.org/document/9117707/
